subject: Programming
title: Continuous Integration
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Continuous Integration.

hook.text: Merge your code into the main branch multiple times a day. If it breaks, you find out in minutes.

buildup.text: CI servers automatically build and test every code change as soon as it's pushed.

discovery.text: Small, frequent merges prevent the nightmare of integration hell â€” days spent fixing merge conflicts.

twist.text: CI only works if tests are fast and reliable. Flaky tests erode trust and get ignored.

climax.text: Teams with good CI catch bugs in minutes instead of weeks. The feedback loop is everything.

punchline.text: Merge often, break less, fix fast.

quiz.question: What does continuous integration automate?
options: Building and testing code on every change
